raw_text:
Wales coach elated with win
 
 Mike Ruddock paid tribute to his Wales side after they came from 15-6 down to beat France 24-18 in the Six Nations.
 
 "After going two tries down in 12 minutes we had to show character," said the national team coach. "I didn't have to tell them anything at half-time because those players have stared down the barrel of a gun before. "They decided they didn't want to do that again and came out fighting. It was a great team effort and we showed great character to come back." Man-of-the-match Stephen Jones, who kicked three penalties, a drop goal and conversion, was ecstatic following after the win at Stade de France.
 
 "It's just a special moment. Two years ago we didn't win a single game in the Six Nations. But we're a very happy camp now," he said. "We worked hard as a squad and I'm a proud Welshman. We've got hard matches to come, so we're just happy with the start." Double try scorer Martyn Williams was keen not to talk about a possible Grand Slam for Wales. "We've got more self-belief these days. Two or three years ago we might have collapsed after going behind so early. "There's no mention of a Grand Slam among the players. We've got a tough game against Scotland at Murrayfield. They could bring us crashing down to earth."
llama3.2:1b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock praised his team after beating France 24-18, saying they showed character and came back from being two tries down in 12 minutes.
Man-of-the-match Stephen Jones kicked several penalties and a drop goal, while Martyn Williams scored a double try.
The win brings Wales' first victory in the Six Nations since 2019.
llama3.2:3b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock praised his team for their character and determination in coming back from 15-6 down to beat France 24-18 in the Six Nations.
Man-of-the-match Stephen Jones said the win was a special moment after two years of no wins, while Martyn Williams expressed caution ahead of upcoming tough matches, including against Scotland.
gemma2:2b: Wales won against France 24-18 in the Six Nations, overcoming a 15-6 deficit.
Coach Mike Ruddock praised the team's character and effort after a strong comeback.
Stephen Jones was named man of the match with his impressive performance.
While players express pride and optimism for future matches, they remain focused on one game at a time, especially against Scotland.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock praised his side's resilience and character after defeating France 24-18 in the Six Nations Championship.
The Welsh team showed great character by not giving up in the initial half-time interval, despite trailing the score early on.
They decided they wouldn't let this happen again, which led to a strong team effort and a comeback victory.
Stephen Jones's outstanding performance with three penalties, a drop goal, and conversion was seen as an excellent example of their skills.
Wales' manager described it as a "special moment" for the Welsh team and praised the hard work of their squad.
Despite having more recent achievements in Grand Slams, the current Welsh side remains focused on upcoming matches against Scotland at Murrayfield.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Wales coach praises team after coming from 15-6 deficit to beat France in Six Nations final, showing resilience and hard work, including Man-of-the-Match Stephen Jones' three impressive kicks and Man of the Match Martyn Williams' two tries, despite Wales being ranked lower than France.
qwen2.5:3b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock praised his team for their comeback win over France, coming from 15-6 behind to win 24-18 in the Six Nations.
Man-of-the-match Stephen Jones expressed happiness following the victory and highlighted the squad's hard work.
Martyn Williams downplayed talk of a Grand Slam, emphasizing Wales' improved self-belief compared to previous years, particularly after being behind early.

He said, "I didn't have to tell them anything at half-time because those players have stared down the barrel of a gun before."
After the win, they chose not to do that again and came out fighting."
Man-of-the-match Stephen Jones, who kicked three penalties, a drop goal and conversion, was ecstatic following.
The win also marked the end of their long campaign as a Welshman."
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock celebrated the win over France 24-18 in the Six Nations after two tries with the team.
They showed character to come back despite a loss, and Stephen Jones, Man-of-the-Match, was ecstatic with three penalties and a drop goal.
It's a special moment as Wales hasn't won a game since their first Six Nations season.
The players are happy now but have some tough matches ahead.
tinyllama:1.1b: Mike Ruddock paid tribute to his Wales squad after they came from behind to beat France 24-18 in the Six Nations.
The national team coach, who also kicked three penalties and a drop goal, was delighted with the win at Stad de France.
Man-of-the-match Stephen Jones expressed gratitude following their successful performance and said it was just a "special moment" for his squad.
He stated that they had worked hard as a group and were proud of their achievements so far in the competition.
Double try scorer Martyn Williams remained focused on winning more games for Wales, but expressed no thoughts on a potential Grand Slam.
The game at Murrayfield is set to follow shortly afterward, and everyone involved in the Welsh squad has a chance to make a mark on the tournament's outcome.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Wales coach Mike Ruddock paid tribute to his team after they secured a thrilling victory over France in the Six Nations, leaving them just two points behind leaders England.
The game was a tight contest with both teams trading tries and penalties but it wasn't until Stephen Jones kicked three penalties and a drop goal that Wales took the lead for the first time.
Man-of-the-match Martyn Williams expressed his pride in his teammates for not letting up despite being two tries down.
"We had some fantastic performances from a squad full of hardworking, passionate men who are ready to work hard every day," he said.
Welsh rugby fans are also celebrating the win as it extends their winning run after losing their first four games in the Six Nations this year.
